meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL?
A critical look at trolling subculture and how we talk about it

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TnHcnX&via=Digg&text=Understanding Internet Trolling

div.div: MONSANTO CORNFIELD MAZE

div.a: Inside NYC's Most Controversial Haunted House

div.div: Is America’s continuing collective fascination with serial killers a deep commentary on the underside of the American myth of self-reliance?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tsfl5N&via=Digg&text=Inside NYC's Most Controversial Haunted House

div.div: MORE FUN THAN BOOING

div.a: Soccer Fans End Match By Setting Fire To Stadium

div.div: Booing is usually a strong enough hint for players to get the message about the mood of the spectators. But soccer fanatics in Senegal weren't into anything so subtle when their team fell hopelessly behind rival Ivory Coast in the African Cup of Nations qualifier.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RxRp4C&via=Digg&text=Soccer Fans End Match By Setting Fire To Stadium

div.div: GATORADE SWAT TEAM
Judging from the first week or so of the Major League Baseball playoffs, it appears that there is now a specialized subset of the brand police: the Gatorade SWAT Team.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RZCgYZ&via=Digg&text=The Gatorade Brand Enforcers

div.div: GALACTIC PASSPORT CONTROL IS A MESS
Could a collection of dusty hangers and sheds in the Californian desert house the future of space flight?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TlxbYi&via=Digg&text=The 'Silicon Valley' Of Space

div.div: TRUTHY

div.a: Watch A Rare Out Of Character Interview With Stephen Colbert

div.div: In an interview this weekend, Stephen Colbert spoke about satire in journalism. What makes this interview unusual is that he broke his character.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SWbjWW&via=Digg&text=Watch A Rare Out Of Character Interview With Stephen Colbert

div.div: BETTER THAN HOW THEY MAKE PAGE 3?

div.a: How Women Make The Front Page

div.div: Victims, experts - or journalists? How are women represented on the front pages of Britain's newspapers?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qni8yx&via=Digg&text=How Women Make The Front Page

div.div: NOT SAFE FOR HYPOCHONDRIACS

div.a: Why Are The British So Bad At Washing Their Hands?

div.div: Fecal matter can be found on just over a quarter of British hands, new research suggests. In some cases the amount of germs is equivalent to the number in a dirty toilet bowl. Why don't people wash their hands?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pxa6X7&via=Digg&text=Why Are The British So Bad At Washing Their Hands?

div.div: VERY GOOD, SIR

div.a: The Newly Rich's Insatiable Desire For Butlers

div.div: Need a job? The butler business is booming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V1QAyJ&via=Digg&text=The Newly Rich's Insatiable Desire For Butlers

div.div: TOUGH TIMES

div.a: Reddit's Most Notorious Troll Loses Job After Gawker Profile

div.div: The former moderator—known in real life as Michael Brutsch, of Arlington, Texas—said on Saturday that he was fired from from his position at a financial services company, leaving him and his disabled wife with little savings and no health insurance.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QiAZsr&via=Digg&text=Reddit's Most Notorious Troll Loses Job After Gawker Profile

div.div: GET FOOD POISONING LIKE MIKE

div.a: Michael Jordan’s ‘McJordan’ 1992 McDonald’s Sauce Hits eBay For $10K

div.div: Goes great on everything from nothing all the way to nothing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tsi5jq&via=Digg&text=Michael Jordan’s ‘McJordan’ 1992 McDonald’s Sauce Hits eBay For $10K

div.div: BRAINS

div.a: Savants: They're Really Nothing Like You

div.div: A team of neuroscientists have taken a deeper look into the mind of Temple Grandin, the world's most famous person with autism. Unsurprisingly, they've discovered a brain that doesn't function like most people's.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ts806f&via=Digg&text=Savants: They're Really Nothing Like You

div.div: YES LADIES, HE'S MARRIED

div.a: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About 'Fearless' Felix (But Were Afraid to Ask)

div.div: What was the most likely thing to kill him during his supersonic jump, what happened to his balloon – and is he married?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WontJn&via=Digg&text=Everything You Always Wanted to Know About 'Fearless' Felix (But Were Afraid to Ask)

div.div: USEFUL PR STUNTS

div.a: 'Hitchcock' Warns Audiences Not To Use Cell Phones In Theaters

div.div: The marketing department for "Hitchcock" has cooked up a pre-screening PSA in which Hopkins-as-Hitch calls in-theater cell phone use one of the biggest horrors around.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RygRqB&via=Digg&text='Hitchcock' Warns Audiences Not To Use Cell Phones In Theaters

div.div: RETIREMENT
Former President George W. Bush’s low profile since leaving office has left the Texan with a lot of time on his hands — and he’s using those hands to keep himself busy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RxMgtp&via=Digg&text=Bush Takes Up Painting

div.div: BOOTY BAILOUTS?

div.a: Somali Pirates Are Losing The Fight For The Sea

div.div: The progress on piracy is striking. For three straight years starting in 2009, Somali pirates grabbed more than 100 vessels. So far this year, the number is 24.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rxqhm9&via=Digg&text=Somali Pirates Are Losing The Fight For The Sea

div.div: DAY ONE
Though their agendas are hidden, both Romney and Obama have plans to dramatically remake the size and character of American government. Very, very quickly.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PwqWFy&via=Digg&text=What Happens On November 7th?

div.div: WILL DRIVE REALLY, REALLY FAST

div.a: 'Need For Speed' Movie Snags 'Breaking Bad' Star

div.div: The two-time Emmy winner, who co-stars in the new film "Smashed," has signed on as the lead in DreamWorks’ upcoming feature film "Need For Speed."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RZJImW&via=Digg&text='Need For Speed' Movie Snags 'Breaking Bad' Star

div.div: LOVES THE TURN-DOWN CHOCOLATES

div.a: The Romney Campaign's Obsession With Marriot

div.div: On the campaign trail, Mitt Romney incessantly talks about his “five points” to get the country moving again, but the only points anyone traveling with the GOP nominee is interested in are Marriott points.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PwicPM&via=Digg&text=The Romney Campaign's Obsession With Marriot

div.div: BESIDES COMMAND IT TO ORDER PIZZA

div.a: What Does Marijuana Actually Do To Your Brain?

div.div: Why do stoners drift off on suprising, imaginative tangents -- and feel like their often bizarre ideas are true epiphanies? A short, informative video from the web series ASAP Science explains the chemistry of getting high.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TU74gv&via=Digg&text=What Does Marijuana Actually Do To Your Brain?

div.div: COULD ALL JUST GET A GROUP POLICY

div.a: Amanda Palmer Enlists 700K Twitter Followers In Health Insurance Fight

div.div: The threat of living without health insurance touches people from all walks of life—from business-savvy Harvard graduates, to aspiring musicians living gig to gig, to everyday Twitter users.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RuzdW6&via=Digg&text=Amanda Palmer Enlists 700K Twitter Followers In Health Insurance Fight

div.div: LIFE IMITATING BOND

div.a: The CIA Has A Flying Skyhook And Actually Used It To Rescue Agents

div.div: This had to be one hell of a ride. The CIA today said it added a pretty cool item to its museum archives - the instruction card for officers being plucked off the ground by a contraption that would allow a person to be snatched off the ground by a flying aircraft.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qjgf3V&via=Digg&text=The CIA Has A Flying Skyhook And Actually Used It To Rescue Agents

div.div: TEXT YOUR FRIENDS ABOUT IT
A research firm has estimated that the use of instant messaging service apps are costing carriers billions of dollars each year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OBk4Fo&via=Digg&text=Whatsapp Costing Carriers Big Money

div.div: NO, HE WASN'T A VAMPIRE HUNTER

div.a: The Real Truth About Thomas Jefferson

div.div: Forget Sally Hemings -- a historian discovers the ugliest side of a founding father in his ledgers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SUEx8Q&via=Digg&text=The Real Truth About Thomas Jefferson

div.div: SHOWS EVERY POPPY SEED OF YOUR BAGEL
Despite its size, I found it wasn’t hard to shoot without a tripod – I recommend a Manopod.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RLKMsB&via=Digg&text=Trying Out The 'Bazooka' Lens

div.div: FOR AMERICA

Glenn Beck denounced Levi's last year after the company featured global protests and revolutions in their ads, and now he's put denim where his mouth is and launched his very own jean line at 1791 Supply & Co.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TUs8TV&via=Digg&text=Glenn Beck Reinvents Blue Jeans

div.div: GO BUY SOMETHING

div.a: Brad Pitt's First Chanel No. 5 Promo Is Out

div.div: After teasing us with a trio of cryptic films last week, Chanel No. 5 has finally unveiled its spot starring Brad Pitt. Although before you sigh in relief: it's just as mystifying as the teasers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TTRHoh&via=Digg&text=Brad Pitt's First Chanel No. 5 Promo Is Out

div.div: FROM SEWING TO SUBMITTING
An evangelical blogger spent 12 months following the Bible. Then she wrote a book about it. Now some Christian bookstores won’t sell it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SY3SKs&via=Digg&text=Her Year Of Living Biblically

div.div: WHY, WHY, WHY?

div.a: Flier Advises College Students On The Top Ten Ways To Get Away With Rape

div.div: A flier found inside the men's room of a freshman co-ed dorm at Ohio's Miami University offering tips on how to "get away with rape" has students concerned, but university officials less so.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QnwEX9&via=Digg&text=Flier Advises College Students On The Top Ten Ways To Get Away With Rape
